attributes.action: Allow a second referendum on the subject of our membership of the European Union
attributes.background: We believe that the "In" or "Out" choice was too simplistic for a decision of such importance and that clear and unbiased information was not available. We believe that we should have been asked additionally, or instead, "Would you chose to remain within a substantially reformed European Union"?

attributes.action: Establish London as an independent state so it can remain in the EU
attributes.background: Greater London voted overwhelmingly to remain. A disproportionate amount of our taxes goes to finance other regions in the UK & our economic wellbeing is severely threatened by a decision imposed upon us by others. We wish to cede from the UK & become an independent state within the EU.

attributes.action: Scrap charges at hospital car parks.
attributes.background: It is unfair and at times a dangerous practice to charge.  It is an essential service and causes problems for visiting routine and emergency appointments.  It causes unnecessary hardship.

attributes.action: Get Washington out of Sunderland and back into County Durham council
attributes.background: Washington is in decline and Sunderland council still do nothing, why should the rest of the city be clean and Washington left out to waste away

attributes.action: Introduce a social awareness lesson within the curriculum.
attributes.background: Bullying and discrimination within schools needs to be stopped. Let's introduce a social awareness lesson to allow youngsters the freedom of speech and allow them to talk about problems open and freely. Educate our youngsters the benefits of talking about problems and acceptance of other people.
attributes.additional_details: By educating youngsters about everyone is different and copes with things in different ways this will allow them to understand others behaviours and attitudes in situations. Mental health is vital within youngsters and allowing them to have a social skills lesson where they can talk about problems and understand that everyone battles life in different ways, and talk about their feelings and worries. Teaching our kids while still young will give them coping mechanisms to deal with different situations and teach them that bullying and discrimination is unacceptable and that not all illnesses/disabilities are visible.

attributes.action: Taking TATA Steel pensioners money by changes to the law is immoral & wrong !!!
attributes.background:
All Pensioners not just TATA Steel pensioners are one of the lowest income areas in our society and to contemplate retrospective law changes after pensioners have signed a legally binding document is wrong and will undoubtably open the floodgates for ALL other businesses to follow.

STOP THIS NOW!
attributes.additional_details:
I strongly DO NOT support cutting pensioners money retrospectively.

If the Government changes the rules, there is nothing to stop ALL businesses doing the same should they find their pensions fund has a deficit.

What happens 3 or 5 or maybe 10 years down the line when the TATA Steel Works is in trouble again. Will the Government change the rules again to take EVEN more money off pensioners?

Its hard enough for Pensioners to live now .....
STOP THIS NOW BEFORE ITS YOUR TURN NEXT !!!

attributes.action: Retain passport/take fingerprints at point of entry to aid later identification.
attributes.background: Many foreigners making Visa entry to the UK to study, or for holidays, later break their Visa conditions, overstay and take work illegally.  If their Passports were retained, and they were given an authorised copy, to use whilst here, they could be easily identified via fingerprints and deported.

attributes.action: Change the law so a Hit and Run driver must serve a life sentence.
attributes.background: Off late there has be a number of Hit and Run Road Traffic incidents where on conviction the vehicle driver was only given a period in prison that in no way reflects the callousness of the crime and the devastating effect this type of crime has on the victims family.

attributes.action: Remove hereditary peers from the House of Lords
attributes.background: The time has come to remove an outdated oddity from Parliament. There is no place for peers who gain their positions simply by being born into them. This is the logical step needed to finish the reforms of 1999.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Abolishing the Welsh Assembly
attributes.background: A petition was created during the last coalition government (2010-15) which was not widely publicised and gained only 3 signatures. The Welsh Assembly elections are about to take place and the "Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party" are encouraging people to sign a petition to call for a 3rd. referendum.
attributes.additional_details: You will find all the supporting material in the Assembly Election pamphlets that are pouring onto our door steps. This gives you all the persuasion you need to support this petition.

attributes.action: Don't make student nurses pay for their tuition
attributes.background: The country is built on its NHS and making nurses pay for their tuition will surely spell the end for this great service and stop thousands from taking up nursing. We need them and the NHS

attributes.action: The PM to report monthly on progress and initiatives to tackle tax avoidance
attributes.background: We increasingly hear about tax avoidance by the rich and by large companies. We also hear politicians say that they are keen to see this issue tackled but warm words aren't enough, let's see a monthly report, including quantifiable measures, so we can see and track progress in a systematic way
attributes.additional_details: Tax avoidance in the UK reputedly costs the UK £16 billion a year. It is not fair and it should be tackled rigorously by the Government and the Prime Minister should be held to account personally

attributes.action: Stop Granting Migrants Citizenship and Help Our Own First!
attributes.background:
1)Migrants that want to be British Citizens should need to have either a high intelligence or trade our country needs. 
2)Migrants to be required to provide evidence of enough money to survive for 2 years and a job prepared. 
3)They shouldn't be allowed to claim ANY benefits for the first 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Britain used to be a strong and powerful country, but this is no longer the case. British citizens believe we should help our people before we offer help to Migrants . We feel let down due to: 1) lack of housing, 2) lack of jobs, 3) cuts to medical care, 4) education spending cuts, 5) cuts to policing, 6) cuts to military, 7) increase in tax cost for the working class 8) lack of humane care for the elderly. We feel this wouldn't be the case if the Government had put US first and not Migrants!

attributes.action: Give votes urgently to the 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum
attributes.background: The political scene is fragile and unstable because of the Government’s small majority with most MPs opposed to Brexit.  Urgently enfranchise the some 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum (46½ million electors) so that future elections and referendums are more properly representative
attributes.additional_details:
The 5½ million are
a) 1.5 million 16- and 17-year olds in the UK (as could vote in the Scottish referendum)
b) 2.0 million British Citizens living abroad disqualified by the 15-year rule or because never on a UK electoral roll (as in the Conservatives’ as-yet unkept “Votes for Life” manifesto promise)
c) 2.2 million unenfranchised foreigners living permanently in the UK (as would be electors if in New Zealand)

Numbers are derived from 2014-15 ONS and UN data. For details visit bit.ly/2cn7hrO

attributes.action: Guarantee rights of UK Nationals resident in other EU states will not change.
attributes.background: As a matter of urgency we call upon the UK government to unambiguously commit to guarantee any ‘Brexit deal’ will ensure all rights currently enjoyed by UK nationals resident in other EU states prior to the triggering of article 50 will remain unchanged.
attributes.additional_details: According to UN estimates 1.2 million UK Citizens have exercised their right as EU citizens to move permanently to other EU states. In many cases, if not most, entire lives are now in adoptive countries. Businesses have been opened, property has been purchased, children have been enrolled in local schools. Many such individuals were denied a voice in the Brexit vote due residency status abroad and / or errors of the electoral committee.

attributes.action: Stop energy companies having the ablity to report to credit reference agencies.
attributes.background:
Companies like Npower have received over 2 million complaints from customers, with a wide range of problems and disputes.

Npower has already been fined 26 million pound.

Once you get into a dispute with the likes of npower they have the power to put bad credit marks within your credit file.
attributes.additional_details:
Npower have had huge problems with there IT systems and customer service levels, customers have been billed in error and many of there customers are subjected to harassment and receive default notices within there credit files through the mismanagement of how npower manager there customers accounts.

Complaints are received on a daily basics and npower are still not being held accountable.

My full story can been seen at http://www.npowercomplaints.uk

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Government should not delay initiating secession because of Germans and French
attributes.background:
Delaying Article 50 because of German and French General Elections in 2017 is a political ruse on the part of Theresa May as the negotiations will not be affected by either result.

There is no reason why negotiations cannot start because a change will be to our advantage and make them easier.
attributes.additional_details:
At present, the two most formidable opponents of Britain in any post Brexit deal will be Merkel and Hollande.  That is the worst case scenario.

If Merkel is displaced, it will likely be by the election of candidates from the AfD.  If Hollande is displaced, it will likely be by the Front Nationale.  In both cases, they are highly Eurosceptical Parties and therefore unlikely to make it difficult for a British withdrawal. They are far more likely to give a good deal for us than at present.

attributes.action: Make UK pet stores ban all pet products made in China
attributes.background: There are cases every single day of dogs and cats dying horrific deaths due to the chemicals and processes used to produce pet products in China. Their relentless disregard for pet health makes them unfit to produce these products and it's time the UK pet stores ban all China-made products.

attributes.action: Put pressure on Asian governments to stop the inhumane act of shark finning.
attributes.background: Shark numbers are declining due to shark finning - this is when a live shark is taken out of the ocean to have its fin cut off and then thrown back into the water. A shark needs its fin to swim and ultimately to survive. Without it the shark soon dies as it can no longer fend for itself.
attributes.additional_details: Each year an estimated 100-200 million sharks are caught for their fins, which often go into the Asian delicacy 'fin soup'. Sharks have been populating our oceans since before the dinosaurs and we can't lose them now. Sharks also play a crucial role in the ecosystem of the ocean by eating sick and dead animals and keeping the seas healthy. By saving sharks we save the oceans and the planet. Shark finning has no place in our modern world and must stop before we lose this ancient species forever.

attributes.action: Improve access to NHS dental services in Cornwall and Devon
attributes.background: According to Cornwall's NHS Dental Helpline, there is a six- to 12-month wait just to get on an NHS dentist's books in Cornwall. In late 2015 there were 7,500 people on the waiting list. We desperately need better access to NHS treatment as few people can afford private dental fees.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.piratefm.co.uk/news/latest-news/1834169/7500-wait-for-a-dentist-in-cornwall/

attributes.action: Mandate our EU representatives veto further EU expansion instead of Brexit
attributes.background: Much of the leave campaign support seemed to surround the potential for Turkey and other countries joining the EU. Rather than leaving the EU, we should mandate that we use our power of veto to ensure that this does not happen.
attributes.additional_details: I have watched countless TV programmes interviewing the supporters and voters of the leave  campaign. This appears to be the main issue, with many saying that the migrants that are here should be allowed to stay. By mandating our power of veto, this would facilitate the UK staying in the EU, with the benefits it brings and stop the EU from expanding by increasing the member countries.

attributes.action: Privatise the Bank of England
attributes.background: The Bank of England was formed in 1694 and nationalised in 1946.  We have reduced the National Debt by privatising Steel, Coal, Utilities, BT and Railways.  Restored to its historical role BoE would be a better controller of the Banks and a check to the Treasury.
attributes.additional_details: Gordon Brown set in place in 1997 a well planned stealth move to undermine democracy and accountability of monetary policy. He also unhooked the Bank Rate from Government borrowing. We now have a situation where there is no political control of our Bank Rate which at 0.5% is detrimental to savers, unfair to those on fixed incomes and those seeking annuities for pensions but very favorable to the Bankers who caused the 2008 crash.

attributes.action: Set up Brexit commission to advise on implications before Article 50 invoked
attributes.background: In the referendum campaign voters asked for the facts but with no historic precedent this left politicians free to say anything to secure votes.  The implications are now much clearer with some known facts to draw on. An independent commission will provide impartial advice before invoking Article 50

attributes.action: Don't rush Brexit: invoke Article 50 after the next general election in 2020.
attributes.background:
The government carried out it's promise to have a referendum; it was not elected to exit the European Union. 

Exiting the European Union is a massive undertaking, and requires planning, strong leadership and clear vision.

For the Brexit to succeed, we need a government elected for the purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Points to consider from the Conservative Manifesto:
"Our commitment to you:
keep our economy secure by running a surplus so that we start paying down our debts."
"We will use our membership of ...the
EU [amongst other organisations]...to achieve the best for Britain."
"We want an EU that helps Britain move ahead..."
"The Conservative Party is the party of the Union
– and we will always do our utmost to keep our family
of nations together."

attributes.action: Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service check
attributes.background:
It is not compulsory for Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check. Previously known as a CRB check.

From the age of 16 you are eligible for Compulsive Basic Training (on a scooter) which means you can have 1:1 tuition from an approved Motorcycle Instructor.
attributes.additional_details:
A teaching profession which involves contact with young people should have DBS check as a mandatory requirement to safeguard the general public.  NHS workers, teachers and approved driving instructors (ADI) all have a DBS check.

The Driving Standards and Vehicles Agency uses the loose term of 'Fit and Proper' to approve a Motorcycle Instructor. Those individuals who have a previous criminal record, or spent time in prison, can still become or continue their role as Motorcycle Instructor.

attributes.action: Require 75% turnout 60% majority for & 16+ voting in future   referendums
attributes.background: Less than 40% of UK Adults voted to for Brexit- a change that can't be reversed.  We must introduce a "triple lock" on future referendums about constitutional and irreversible changes.  The turn out must exceed 75%,  the majority in favour of change must exceed 60% and all those aged 16+ can vote

attributes.action: Keep the United Kingdom inside the European Economic Area (EEA) and rejoin EFTA.
attributes.background:
-A supermajority of young people voted to remain inside the European Union
-We now know the consequences truly of voting to leave and Article 50 hasn't yet been triggered.
-Hundreds of thousands if not millions of Leave voters regret their decision
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned pledge our support for the United Kingdom remaining a part of the EEA, which includes the EU alongside Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway. We pledge our support for rejoining the European Free Trade Agreement, which we established in 1960 and led until 1973. EEA member countries outside the EU participate in its single market but can also negotiate trade agreements freely and independently. We the British people would also continue to have de facto European Union citizenship.

attributes.action: Introduce elections for selecting the UK Prime Minister
attributes.background:
An argument of the Brexit camp was that the EU does not reflect a democratic instutition. 

Standard practice is that the individual chosen to lead their political party is also the candidate for UK PM. The UK electorate should be able to cast a separate vote on who they feel should be PM.

attributes.action: That Non Stun slaughter be debated in Parliament.
attributes.background: I have researched what the doctrinal basis for Shechita is. We are in the new millennium and Shechita slaughter is no longer the most humane way to kill. When the Holy Prophet was alive, stunning methods used today did not exist.
attributes.additional_details:
The Food Research Institute state that killing an animal before it is bled out by high voltage electrical stunning does not affect the amount of blood lost from the carcass.  I have spoken to Jewish people on this issue they say they can see no reason why animals cannot be stunned first.
A witness to Shechita slaughter described a knife was drawn 17 times across a bullocks throat. A shock on his face as he tried to move away.

attributes.action: Don't ban menthol cigarettes
attributes.background:
Plain packaging is coming into force and there is a proposal to ban menthol cigarettes. 


Menthol cigarettes makes up a large percentage of smokers and has existed for almost a hundred years.


Ban other flavours but make an exception for menthols like the US.
attributes.additional_details:
I thought all cigarettes were the same, so why treat some cigarettes different to others?


- Ban flavours, keep the menthol


- Halt any new anti-tobbaco law for at least 10 years 


- Don't allow cigarette prices to reach £15 by 2020

attributes.action: Ethical consumption rating to be displayed alongside price for all products
attributes.background:
Our current consumption culture focuses on price. The true cost of buying that product is rarely reflected in the price.

The introduction of an ethical consumption traffic light system at brand level will enable conscientious consumers to easily make informed decisions about what they buy.
attributes.additional_details:
An ethical rating should be founded on the following core principles:
 -Environmental impact
 -People (wages, working conditions, exploitation of employees)
 -Animals (animal testing, welfare of animals)
 -Political activity
 -Product Sustainability (Organic, Fairtrade, Positive Environmental Features)

attributes.action: Make 23 April "NHS appreciation day"
attributes.background: 1 and 17 March, and 30 November are bank holidays in Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland. There is no such holiday on 23 April in England. This date should be nominated as appreciation day of a Great British and Northern Irish institution to unite all who benefit from this service around the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS makes me proud to be a citizen of the UK. As I sit here and write this from my baby son's bedside on a children's ward, I am moved to tears by the care he is receiving tonight from highly trained and caring professionals who have left their own family behind to care for mine. What is most amazing is that this is free at the point of use for all. Why not dedicate a day per year for the appreciation of the NHS and its staff.

attributes.action: Restore incentives for community owned renewable onshore wind
attributes.background:
A recent report reveals more than two thirds of the public support renewable energy schemes where projects are undertaken at a community level and local people receive financial benefit.
We , the signatories of this petition call upon parliament to revisit support for on shore wind subsidies.
attributes.additional_details:
News story on Community Energy report :
http://www.theecologist.org/News/news_round_up/2988096/massive_support_for_community_renewable_energy.html

attributes.action: Vote on whether the Houses of Parliament should be refurbished or rebuilt.
attributes.background: In a time of mass austerity, £4b to refurbish The Houses of Parliament over 6 years NOT including fees for renting elsewhere. £7.1b over 32 years if they stay inside. We the people believe that the palace should be kept for historical value and a new building be built for a fraction of the price.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is there. This needs to be done and the savings go back into the publics purse, helping stop austerity on the sick and disabled. Fund more homeless shelters, stock the food banks!!! Act NOW not tomorrow!

http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/708740/houses-of-parliament-restoration-48bn-to-do-list-westminster

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/parliament-refurbishment-7bn-westminster-revamp-faces-three-year-delay-a6872141.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37303682

attributes.action: Make basic paediatric first aid/cpr part of antenatal care
attributes.background: Many babies/young children could be saved if new parents were given guidance on simple cpr and first aid in relation to babies and young children. Early Years Professionals and healthcare professionals receive training, however, parents (who are with their children the majority of the time) do not.

attributes.action: abolish hate crime laws in the UK
attributes.background: A crime is a crime. the motivation for committing the offence should be inconsequential to the sentencing. Labelling an offence as racially, religiously or gender motivated only serves to create an 'us and them' mentality.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months police have been silencing anti  Islam and anti  refugee opinions by labelling them as hate crimes. recently Nottinghamshire police have taken the law into their own hands and have made misogyny a hate crime (but not misandry). This has turned certain groups into protected classes in society.

attributes.action: Give the NHS a percentage of tuition fees from all HE health careers courses.
attributes.background: The NHS would benefit from extra funding. They should be given a percentage of tuition fees from all health careers courses. Students studying these courses should oblige as the NHS is the future for the majority of their career. The extra funds would help with the upkeep and development of the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is suffering from a lack of funding and a lack of staff. If they were to recieve a percentage of student tuition fees (only from health related courses) then there would be a boost in funding. It could also be an incentive to encourage more people to study these courses and eventually work for the NHS, as they would feel as though there University costs have contributed to their future career on another level.

attributes.action: Stop legally classifying pets as property.
attributes.background: Pets are not property. They are loving companions, family members, they can perform important tasks. The theft, abuse, murder of pets causes deep psycological and emotional distress and crimes against people's pets must be taken extremely seriously in court and perpetrators severely punished.

attributes.action: Have a referendum on term time leave from school for families, and not be fined
attributes.background: Many working families either cannot afford school holiday prices or parents cannot get time off work during the school holidays. Families feel that we are being penalised by being threatened with fines or prison and that children are missing out quality family time.
attributes.additional_details: By having this referendum it will give families hope that the government is listening to families and understand there frustrations, school is very important to a child's future but so is the opportunity of spending really quality time with there family once a year for a one week or two week break.

attributes.action: We want to make a change to the government cuts towards disabled people.
attributes.background: NCS Wave 9 Black Country A Team Jackman are campaigning to help change the attitude of the government and where they place their money. They have cut back too much on the funding for the disabled and we want to make a change, this petition will help us make that difference that could change lives.
attributes.additional_details: We are working with our Patener charity Let Us Play, an organisation that works with disabled and vulnerable children from the ages 5-19. They do amazing work to help the children have a fun filled life. However they struggle to get the essentials that they need due to the government cuts towards disabled people for example, there used to be 27 rest bite beds in Wolverhampton alone and over the past few years it has reduced to 3. How unfair is that?

attributes.action: Stop the use of the honours system being used for political gain
attributes.background: All honours to be authorised only via an independent political free board. All members of the board must be free of any political party and any person who has held political office or served in a government department to be barred from holding office on this board
attributes.additional_details: Any person is permitted to put a person forward for any honour . In doing so they must state why they believe such person deserves this award.

attributes.action: Introduce a law for all branded takeaway coffee cups to be easily recycled.
attributes.background:
Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall has alerted us all to the environmental damage that the humble coffee cup can cause. 
See his war on waste program: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07m8qwz
If legislation was introduced to force the large coffee chains to act then this problem would quickly disappear.

attributes.action: Revise the Honours system.
attributes.background: A cross-party body be set up to radically review the UK Honours system and replace it with one that works according to widely supported criteria and does not reward people for their political allegiances.
attributes.additional_details: Transparent and publicly supported criteria for awarding honours are required which reward people for services to community, the economy, country, mankind and the natural world, but not solely for political allegiance.

attributes.action: Call on Theresa May to scrap Hinckley C
attributes.background:
Call on Theresa May to scrap Hinkley C

I have no in principle objection to nuclear power. Neither do I wish to comment on cost, no-one on the planet knows whether the strike price will be good bad or indifferent in 10, 20 or 30 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Firstly we do not know if it will work! There is no working version to base a decision on. What if in 8 years we find it doesn't? We will have a serious problem.

Second, EDF will come under huge pressure to make it work and make it work by 2025, what short cuts might they be tempted to perform as a consequence?

Finally, the world political scene is unclear for the next 5 years let alone 30+ years, we simply should not put the energy production for our country in the hands of other countries.

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation of Lancaster Post Office
attributes.background: Lancaster Post Office has become a historic local institution providing a wide range of services. Relocating it could reduce the service offered to customers in the long run, make access difficult for the disabled and the elderly and would be unsuitable for people who don't like crowded spaces.
attributes.additional_details: The current post office is spacious which enables it to offer a wide range of services, it is on the ground floor, very close to town centre, is a couple of minutes walk from a large car park on Dallas Road and is next door to the local Royal Mail Delivery Office. W.H Smiths would offer non of these advantages except the fact it is in town centre because there is no nearby parking and having postal vans would have to go through a pedestrianised area.

attributes.action: Change in Immigration rules due to the immigration solicitors negligence
attributes.background: Our application  for leave to remain was simply rejected because our Immigration solicitor showed negligence in our application, after spending 11 years in UK we are now on verge to be removed from UK, I request everyone to sign this petition and bring change in immigration rules
attributes.additional_details:
We want Secretary of State to consider Solicitor's negligence as an exceptional circumstances.

For Example Law includes below as exceptional circumstances currently :
o travel or postal delays. 
or beyond control situation for applicant.
For example:
o The Home Office has lost or delayed returning travel documents.
o The applicant is having problems replacing lost documents as a result of theft, fire or
flood. 

but Point requested to be included in Law is as below:
o Your previous solicitor's showed negligence in your case and you have evidance from legal ombudsman to prove solicitors negligence.

attributes.action: Early diagnosis for children with autism. Help afterwards.
attributes.background: 'Postcode' lottery for early diagnosis. No help once a diagnosis is made depending where you live.

attributes.action: Impose a tuition fee cap for international students
attributes.background: The fees for Home/EU students are controlled by the UK Government; however, there isn't a cap for the international students. Institutions may charge international students up to 3 times the Home/EU fees. In addition, institutions may continue to raise the tuition fees. This should be capped.

attributes.action: Empty black bins once a week in summer and hot spells.
attributes.background: I, like many others suffer during the summer and sometimes other seasons  with fly and maggots in my black bin, even though I have it cleaned after every empty. I think the government should force councils to empty the black bins once a week during hot spells to reduce this.
